posts.text: The way the first paper goes about sampling from the power distribution is expensive. The second paper figures out a way to sample from an approximation of the same distribution that requires less MCMC exploration (i.e. generates samples faster)

reply_context.text:
The 1st paper shows that sampling with temp isn't actually sampling from the power dist and demonstrates a way to achieve that. Because this is functionally a kind of "look-ahead", it has the effect that it produces results similar to RL training for reasoning, but w/o any addl training.

...

reply_context.text:
The stochasticity of (autoregressive) LLM sampling is usually governed by a "temperature" parameter that takes the functional form of an exponent, so it looks similar to that power distribution.

if X is a monte carlo transition matrix, then taking X to the kth power -- X^k -- gives you the probabilities of transitioning to those states in k-steps.

X^k is the "power" distribution they're describing here.

posts.text: I don't doubt that we're in an "AI bubble" in the sense that most AI ventures are vaporware snakeoil and a lot of those businesses will fail. But people who use that phrase to mean "all AI use cases are destined to fail and even the big labs will soon flop" simply have no idea what's going.

iPhone's automated AI image enhancements used to be good, now they do way more harm than good. Check out how it mutilated the text on this dog wall. second image is a close up from the first, third was taken with focus digitally zoomed in for comparison.
it means if bluesky goes down, you'll know why

reply_context.text:
ðŸ§© Quick quiz! You choose, uniformly and independently (with replacement) from your bag, which holds n Pokeballs, each containing a different Pokemon.

How many balls do you need to draw* before you see each Pokemon at least once? At least twice?

And before you see some Pokemon at least thrice?

Chief Judge Schilitz of MN (Scalia clerk) orders ICE director Todd Lyons to appear before him Friday. Says his "patience is at an end." Says his order to release or hold bail hearing for a detainee was defied as have dozens of other such orders. 
1/2

Let's circle back to this bullshit now that a modicum of sanity has cracked the reality altering field surrounding this administration.

Impeach Kash Patel.

BREAKING:

Minnesota's chief federal judge has demanded the acting head of ICE personally appear in court Friday to explain what the judge described as repeated failures to comply with dozens of court orders amid its enforcement efforts in the state.
